AlertGet.description: The method allows to retrieve alerts according to the given parameters.

parameters.description: Return the number of records in the result instead of the actual data.
parameters.name: countOutput

parameters.description: If set to true return only objects that the user has write permissions to.  Default: false.
parameters.name: editable

parameters.description: Return results that do not match the criteria given in the search parameter.
parameters.name: excludeSearch

parameters.description: Return only those results that exactly match the given filter. Accepts an array, where the keys are property names, and the values are either a single value or an array of values to match against. Doesn't work for text fields.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: Limit the number of records returned.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Object properties to be returned. Default: extend.
parameters.name: output

parameters.description: Use IDs as keys in the resulting array.
parameters.name: preservekeys

parameters.description: Return results that match the given wildcard search (case-insensitive). Accepts an array, where the keys are property names, and the values are strings to search for. If no additional options are given, this will perform a LIKE "%…%" search. Works only for string and text fields.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: If set to true return results that match any of the criteria given in the filter or search parameter instead of all of them. Default: false.
parameters.name: searchByAny

parameters.description: If set to true enables the use of "*" as a wildcard character in the search parameter. Default: false.
parameters.name: searchWildcardsEnabled

parameters.description: Sort the result by the given properties. Refer to a specific API get method description for a list of properties that can be used for sorting. Macros are not expanded before sorting. If no value is specified, data will be returned unsorted.
parameters.name: sortfield

parameters.description: Order of sorting. If an array is passed, each value will be matched to the corresponding property given in the sortfield parameter.
parameters.name: sortorder

parameters.description: The search parameter will compare the beginning of fields, that is, perform a LIKE "…%" search instead. Ignored if searchWildcardsEnabled is set to true.
parameters.name: startSearch

parameters.description: Return only alerts with the given IDs.
parameters.name: alertids

parameters.description: Return only alerts generated by the given actions.
parameters.name: actionids

parameters.description: Return only alerts generated by the given events.
parameters.name: eventids

parameters.description: Return only alerts generated by objects from the given host groups.
parameters.name: groupids

parameters.description: Return only alerts generated by objects from the given hosts.
parameters.name: hostids

parameters.description: Return only message alerts that used the given media types.
parameters.name: mediatypeids

parameters.description: Return only alerts generated by the given objects
parameters.name: objectids

parameters.description: Return only message alerts that were sent to the given users.
parameters.name: userids

parameters.description: Return only alerts generated by events related to objects of the given type. See event 'object' for a list of supported object types.  Default: 0 - trigger.
parameters.name: eventobject

parameters.description: Return only alerts generated by events of the given type. See event 'source' for a list of supported event types.  Default: 0 - trigger events.
parameters.name: eventsource

parameters.description: Return only alerts that have been generated after the given time.
parameters.name: time_from

parameters.description: Return only alerts that have been generated before the given time.
parameters.name: time_till

parameters.description: Return a hosts property with data of hosts that triggered the action operation.
parameters.name: selectHosts

parameters.description: Return a mediatypes property with an array of the media types that were used for the message alert.
parameters.name: selectMediatypes

parameters.description: Return a users property with an array of the users that the message was addressed to.
parameters.name: selectUsers

parameters.description: Sort the result by the given properties.
parameters.name: sortfield

Apiinfo.description: This method allows to retrieve the version of the Zabbix API.
Apiinfo.returns: (string) Returns the version of the Zabbix API.

EventGet.description: The method allows to retrieve events according to the given parameters.

parameters.description: Return only events with the given IDs.
parameters.name: eventids

parameters.description: Return only events created by objects that belong to the given host groups.
parameters.name: groupids

parameters.description: Return only events created by objects that belong to the given hosts.
parameters.name: hostids

parameters.description: Return only events created by the given objects.
parameters.name: objectids

parameters.description: Return only events with the given type.  Refer to the event object page for a list of supported event types.  Default: 0 - trigger events.
parameters.name: source

parameters.description: Return only events created by objects of the given type.  Refer to the event object page for a list of supported object types.  Default: 0 - trigger.
parameters.name: object

parameters.description: If set to true return only acknowledged events.
parameters.name: acknowledged

parameters.description: true - return only suppressed events; false - return events in the normal state.
parameters.name: suppressed

parameters.description: Return only events with given event severities. Applies only if object is trigger.
parameters.name: severities

parameters.description: Rules for tag searching.
parameters.name: evaltype

parameters.description: Return only events with given tags. Exact match by tag and case-insensitive search by value and operator.
parameters.name: tags

parameters.description: Return only events with IDs greater or equal to the given ID.
parameters.name: eventid_from

parameters.description: Return only events with IDs less or equal to the given ID.
parameters.name: eventid_till

parameters.description: Return only events that have been created after or at the given time.
parameters.name: time_from

parameters.description: Return only events that have been created before or at the given time.
parameters.name: time_till

parameters.description: Returns only events that were in the problem state starting with problem_time_from. Applies only if the source is trigger event and object is trigger. Mandatory if problem_time_till is specified.
parameters.name: problem_time_from

parameters.description: Returns only events that were in the problem state until problem_time_till. Applies only if the source is trigger event and object is trigger. Mandatory if problem_time_from is specified.
parameters.name: problem_time_till

parameters.description: Return only events with the given values.
parameters.name: value

parameters.description: Return a hosts property with hosts containing the object that created the event. Supported only for events generated by triggers, items or LLD rules.
parameters.name: selectHosts

parameters.description: Return a relatedObject property with the object that created the event. The type of object returned depends on the event type.
parameters.name: selectRelatedObject

parameters.description: Return an alerts property with alerts generated by the event. Alerts are sorted in reverse chronological order.
parameters.name: select_alerts

parameters.description: Return an acknowledges property with event updates. Event updates are sorted in reverse chronological order.  The event update object has the following properties: acknowledgeid - (string) acknowledgment's ID; userid - (string) ID of the user that updated the event; eventid - (string) ID of the updated event; clock - (timestamp) time when the event was updated; message - (string) text of the message; action - (integer) update action that was performed see event.acknowledge; old_severity - (integer) event severity before this update action; new_severity - (integer) event severity after this update action; username - (string) username of the user that updated the event; name - (string) name of the user that updated the event; surname - (string) surname of the user that updated the event.  Supports count.
parameters.name: select_acknowledges

parameters.description: Return a tags property with event tags.
parameters.name: selectTags

parameters.description: Return a suppression_data property with the list of active maintenances and manual suppressions
parameters.name: selectSuppressionData

suppress_until.description: time until the event is suppressed

userid.description: ID of user who suppressed the event

HostCreate.description: This method allows to create new hosts. This method is only available to Admin and Super admin user types. Permissions to call the method can be revoked in user role settings. See User roles for more information.

parameters.description: Description of the host
parameters.name: description

parameters.description: Origin of the host.
parameters.name: flags

parameters.description: Technical name of the host.
parameters.name: host

parameters.description: ID of the host.
parameters.name: hostid

parameters.description: Host inventory population mode.
parameters.name: inventory_mode

parameters.description: IPMI authentication algorithm.
parameters.name: ipmi_authtype

parameters.description: IPMI password.
parameters.name: ipmi_password

parameters.description: IPMI privilege level.
parameters.name: ipmi_privilege

parameters.description: IPMI username.

parameters.description: Starting time of the effective maintenance.

parameters.name: maintenance_status

parameters.description: Effective maintenance type.
parameters.name: maintenance_type

parameters.name: maintenanceid

parameters.description: Visible name of the host.  Default: host property value.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: ID of the proxy that is used to monitor the host.
parameters.name: proxy_hostid

parameters.description: Status and function of the host.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Connections from host.
parameters.name: tls_accept

parameters.description: Connections to host.
parameters.name: tls_connect

parameters.description: Certificate issuer.
parameters.name: tls_issuer

parameters.description: (write-only) The preshared key, at least 32 hex digits. Required if either tls_connect or tls_accept has PSK enabled.
parameters.name: tls_psk

parameters.description: (write-only) PSK identity. Required if either tls_connect or tls_accept has PSK enabled.  Do not put sensitive information in the PSK identity, it is transmitted unencrypted over the network to inform a receiver which PSK to use.

parameters.description: Certificate subject.

parameters.description: Host inventory properties.

Multiple parameters are separated by LF ()character.  error_handler - (string) Action type used in case of preprocessing step failure: 0 - Error message is set by Zabbix server; 1 - Discard value; 2 - Set custom value; 3 - Set custom error message.  error_handler_params - (string) Error handler parameters.

ProblemGet.description: The method allows to retrieve problems according to the given parameters. This method is for retrieving unresolved problems. It is also possible, if specified, to additionally retrieve recently resolved problems. The period that determines how old is "recently" is defined in Administration → General. Problems that were resolved prior to that period are not kept in the problem table. To retrieve problems that were resolved further back in the past, use the event.get method.

parameters.description: Return only problems with the given IDs.
parameters.name: eventids

parameters.description: Return only problems created by objects that belong to the given host groups.
parameters.name: groupids

parameters.description: Return only problems created by objects that belong to the given hosts.
parameters.name: hostids

parameters.description: Return only problems created by the given objects.
parameters.name: objectids

parameters.description:
Return only problems with the given type.

Refer to the problem event object page for a list of supported event types.

Default: 0 - problem created by a trigger.
parameters.name: source

parameters.description: Return only problems created by objects of the given type. Refer to the problem event object page for a list of supported object types. Default: 0 - trigger.
parameters.name: object

parameters.description:
true - return acknowledged problems only;
false - unacknowledged only.
parameters.name: acknowledged

parameters.description:
true - return only suppressed problems;
false - return problems in the normal state.
parameters.name: suppressed

parameters.description: Return only problems with given event severities. Applies only if object is trigger.
parameters.name: severities

parameters.description:
Rules for tag searching.

Possible values:
0 - (default) And/Or;
2 - Or.
parameters.name: evaltype

parameters.description: Return only problems with given tags. Exact match by tag and case-insensitive search by value and operator.

parameters.description: return PROBLEM and recently RESOLVED problems (depends on Display OK triggers for N seconds)

parameters.description: Return only problems that have been created after or at the given time.
parameters.name: time_from

parameters.description: Return only problems that have been created before or at the given time.
parameters.name: time_till

parameters.description:
Return an acknowledges property with the problem updates. Problem updates are sorted in reverse chronological order.

The problem update object has the following properties:
acknowledgeid - (string) update's ID;
userid - (string) ID of the user that updated the event;
eventid - (string) ID of the updated event;
clock - (timestamp) time when the event was updated;
message - (string) text of the message;
action - (integer)type of update action (see event.acknowledge);
old_severity - (integer) event severity before this update action;
new_severity - (integer) event severity after this update action;
suppress_until - (timestamp) time till event will be suppressed;

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectAcknowledges

parameters.description: Return a tags property with the problem tags. Output format: [{"tag": "<tag>", "value": "<value>"}, ...].
parameters.name: selectTags

parameters.description:

maintenanceid - (string) ID of the maintenance;
userid - (string) ID of user who suppressed the problem;
suppress_until - (integer) time until the problem is suppressed.

parameters.description: Return triggers from the template in the triggers property. Supports count.

TriggerGet.description: The method allows to retrieve triggers according to the given parameters.

parameters.description: Return only triggers with the given IDs.
parameters.name: triggerids

parameters.description: Return only triggers that belong to hosts or templates from the given host groups or template groups.
parameters.name: groupids

parameters.description: Return only triggers that belong to the given templates.
parameters.name: templateids

parameters.description: Return only triggers that belong to the given hosts.
parameters.name: hostids

parameters.description: Return only triggers that contain the given items.
parameters.name: itemids

parameters.description: Return only triggers that use the given functions.  Refer to the supported function page for a list of supported functions.
parameters.name: functions

parameters.description: Return only triggers that belong to hosts or templates from the host group or template group with the given name.
parameters.name: group

parameters.description: Return only triggers that belong to host with the given name.
parameters.name: host

parameters.description: If set to true return only triggers inherited from a template.
parameters.name: inherited

parameters.description: If set to true return only triggers that belong to templates.
parameters.name: templated

parameters.description: If set to true return only triggers that have dependencies. If set to false return only triggers that do not have dependencies.
parameters.name: dependent

parameters.description: Return only enabled triggers that belong to monitored hosts and contain only enabled items.
parameters.name: monitored

parameters.description: Return only enabled triggers that belong to monitored hosts.
parameters.name: active

parameters.description: If set to true return only enabled triggers that belong to hosts in maintenance.
parameters.name: maintenance

parameters.description: Return only triggers that have unacknowledged events.
parameters.name: withUnacknowledgedEvents

parameters.description: Return only triggers with all events acknowledged.
parameters.name: withAcknowledgedEvents

parameters.description: Return only triggers with the last event unacknowledged.
parameters.name: withLastEventUnacknowledged

parameters.description: Skip triggers in a problem state that are dependent on other triggers. Note that the other triggers are ignored if disabled, have disabled items or disabled item hosts.
parameters.name: skipDependent

parameters.description: Return only triggers that have changed their state after the given time.
parameters.name: lastChangeSince

parameters.description: Return only triggers that have changed their state before the given time.
parameters.name: lastChangeTill

parameters.description: Return only triggers that have recently been in a problem state.
parameters.name: only_true

parameters.description: Return only triggers with severity greater or equal than the given severity.
parameters.name: min_severity

parameters.description: Rules for tag searching.  Possible values: 0 - (default) And/Or; 2 - Or.
parameters.name: evaltype

parameters.description: Return only triggers with given tags. Exact match by tag and case-sensitive or case-insensitive search by tag value depending on operator value
parameters.name: tags

parameters.description: Expand macros in the trigger description.
parameters.name: expandComment

parameters.description: Expand macros in the name of the trigger.
parameters.name: expandDescription

parameters.description: Expand functions and macros in the trigger expression.
parameters.name: expandExpression

parameters.description: Return the host groups that the trigger belongs to in the host groups property.
parameters.name: selectHostGroups

parameters.description: Return the hosts that the trigger belongs to in the hosts property.
parameters.name: selectHosts

parameters.description: Return items contained by the trigger in the items property.
parameters.name: selectItems

parameters.description: Return functions used in the trigger in the functions property.  The function objects represent the functions used in the trigger expression and has the following properties: functionid - (string) ID of the function; itemid - (string) ID of the item used in the function; function - (string) name of the function; parameter - (string) parameter passed to the function. Query parameter is replaced by $ symbol in returned string.
parameters.name: selectFunctions

parameters.description: Return triggers that the trigger depends on in the dependencies property.
parameters.name: selectDependencies

parameters.description: Return the low-level discovery rule that created the trigger.
parameters.name: selectDiscoveryRule

parameters.description: Return the last significant trigger event in the lastEvent property.
parameters.name: selectLastEvent

parameters.description: Return the trigger tags in tags property.
parameters.name: selectTags

parameters.description: Return the template groups that the trigger belongs to in the template groups property.
parameters.name: selectTemplateGroups

parameters.description: Return the trigger discovery object in the triggerDiscovery property. The trigger discovery objects link the trigger to a trigger prototype from which it was created.  It has the following properties: parent_triggerid - (string) ID of the trigger prototype from which the trigger has been created.
parameters.name: selectTriggerDiscovery

parameters.description: Return only those results that exactly match the given filter.  Accepts an array, where the keys are property names, and the values are either a single value or an array of values to match against.  Supports additional filters: host - technical name of the host that the trigger belongs to; hostid - ID of the host that the trigger belongs to.

UserCheckAuth.description: This method checks and prolongs user session.

parameters.description: Default value: "true". Setting it's value to "false" allows to check session without extending it's lifetime. Supported since Zabbix 4.0.
parameters.name: extend

parameters.description: User session id.
parameters.name: sessionid

UserCheckAuth.returns: (object) Returns an object containing information about user.

UserCreate.description: his method allows to create new users.

parameters.description: User's password.  Can be omitted if user is added only to groups that have LDAP access.
parameters.name: passwd

parameters.description: User groups to add the user to.  The user groups must have the usrgrpid property defined.
parameters.name: usrgrps

parameters.description: User media to be created.
parameters.name: medias

parameters.description: User name.
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: Whether to enable auto-login.  Possible values: 0 - (default) auto-login disabled; 1 - auto-login enabled.
parameters.name: autologin

parameters.description: User session life time. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix. If set to 0s, the session will never expire.  Default: 15m.
parameters.name: autologout

parameters.description: Language code of the user's language, for example, en_GB.  Default: default - system default.
parameters.name: lang

parameters.description: Name of the user.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Automatic refresh period. Accepts seconds and time unit with suffix.  Default: 30s.
parameters.name: refresh

parameters.description: Amount of object rows to show per page.  Default: 50.
parameters.name: rows_per_page

parameters.description: Surname of the user.
parameters.name: surname

parameters.description: User's theme.  Possible values: default - (default) system default; blue-theme - Blue; dark-theme - Dark.
parameters.name: theme

parameters.description: URL of the page to redirect the user to after logging in.
parameters.name: url

parameters.description: User's time zone, for example, Europe/London, UTC.  Default: default - system default.  For the full list of supported time zones please refer to PHP documentation.
parameters.name: timezone

parameters.description: Role ID of the user.
parameters.name: roleid

UserCreate.returns: (object) Returns an object containing the IDs of the created users under the userids property. The order of the returned IDs matches the order of the passed users.

UserLogin.description: This method allows to log in to the API and generate an authentication token.

parameters.description: (Required) User password.
parameters.name: password

parameters.name: username

parameters.description: Return information about the authenticated user.
